chapter.title: Configure Qodana Cloud
chapter.p: To see %product% reports in the %product_cloud% UI, you need to get them uploaded. Before you can start to upload them, you need to create a project and generate a project-related token as described below.

list.li: On the Projects page, click the New project button in the upper-right corner.
If needed, you can configure the newly created project.
Click Generate token to generate the project token.

li.p: Copy the project token and save it for future use.
li.note: Once generated, the token is available for copying only before the first report is pushed to the project. The same rule applies to project configuration.

chapter.title: Configure forwarding of reports
chapter.p: This chapter explains how to configure the following products for forwarding %product% reports to %product_cloud%:

chapter.title: Docker

In this snippet, --send-report enables forwarding %product% reports to %product_cloud%, and the -t option is used to specify the project token.
For more details about configuration options, see the configuration options of your linter.

chapter.title: GitHub Actions
chapter.p: To start receiving %product% reports using GitHub Actions, create an encrypted secret with the QODANA_TOKEN name.
Add this snippet to the workflow:
chapter.code: - name: 'Qodana Scan' uses: JetBrains/qodana-action@main env: QODANA_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.QODANA_TOKEN }}

chapter.title: GitLab CI/CD
chapter.p: To forward %product% reports using GitLab CI/CD, define the QODANA_TOKEN variable in your repository.
Add this snippet to your CI/CD pipeline:
chapter.code: qodana: image: name: jetbrains/qodana-<linter> entrypoint: [''] script: - qodana --results-dir=$CI_PROJECT_DIR/qodana --save-report --report-dir=$CI_PROJECT_DIR/qodana/report --send-report artifacts: paths: - qodana

chapter.title: TeamCity plugin
chapter.p: To configure a TeamCity plugin to forward %product% reports to %product_cloud%, follow these steps:

procedure.step: Create the QODANA_TOKEN environment variable and define it as password.

step.p: Add --send-report to the Additional arguments for the entry point section and -e QODANA_TOKEN=%env.QODANA_TOKEN% to the Additional arguments for 'docker run'.

chapter.p: If necessary, repeat the third step for each TeamCity plugin instance. For example, you may want to configure the Code inspection, Clone Finder, and License Audit TeamCity plugins on the same runner.
